recommendations.recommendation: Considering the main protagonist is actually an adult, I was hoping for a somewhat more adult like presentation and storytelling. But unfortunately that wasn`t the case. This is just the typical highschool life/romance anime series but with a twist. I also thought this series was a bit predictable at times. If you decide to watch this show then by all means watch the OVA because at least it has a proper ending, unlike the main series. It`s basically a continuation. Still, I`m glad that I watched it and I would recommend it for fans of romance.

This show is like a breath of fresh air. There`s nothing terribly interesting or exciting about it, but it`s still fun and refreshing, and find you want to take another and another. Even after a marathon of more than half the season you feel no exhaustion or tension from the condensed watching, and might even feel calmer and more content.
Doctor`s prescription: Every time you find your life too hectic or tense, I recommend watching an episode or two.

A fine watch.
This show is all about a mature adult watching those of less maturity do `their thing` (青春, seishun). It gave me the feeling of being `an outsider` --- just as intended, I guess. The various characters had their little friend circles going on and most of this show was watching them roll, from the outside. The protagonist made an occasional intervention here and there but no more. Practically all of the character relationships were set in stone from the beginning, so the outsider-feeling came as no surprise (but as a slight disappointment, though).
If you want some quite mature content in the sense of self-reflection, then I`d recommend this, but don`t expect any romance, for there`s practically none of that in a meaningful sense (not to say there isn`t any). The drama is quite bland, but still somehow managed to escape cheesiness; stereotypical, perhaps, but pleasant to watch.
An interesting series, with some deep topics: highly recommended!

Really great anime! Nice character, deep character development and a good plot. You`d never guess this is a web anime - it`s easily one of the best anime of this season, even of this year!
Check it out, you won`t regret it.

Pretty solid watch, the main character and his interactions are the most interesting part of the series and what he wrestles with whilst watching the teens really got me hooked enough to finish it in two nights. The supporting cast are rather awesome, and the expected drama does drag you in and get you quite invested.
Truly slice of life at it`s best with a unique little twist.

A really great anime. This is not a normal school anime compared to others with ecchi or funny moments. You are gonna be surprised at how amazing realistic the character developments are and start liking the characters.
Great show for everyone and especially for those who want to learn about relationships.
Honestly, such a great reflection of NEETs and their lives without having the forced "I`m an otaku because the audience is all otakus" character traits. Season 2 when?
So warming heart, and smooth storyline. Interesting concept about slice of life, and may change your way of life. Must see if you are fans of warm slice of life.
Hilarious, well-written and EXCELLENT character development. Very competent main character and great pay-off despite leaving room for a second season.

This is an amazing series. the development of all the cast is astounding. I didn`t realise this was a web series until I was about to write this review. There are many laugh out loud moments and I mean loads!!!!! The animation is well on point cannot fault it one bit. The story is interesting and charming a must watch in my books if you like Romance / High School anime. You will not regret this!!!!

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch79914 [Kaizaki Arata], a 27-year-old jobless man, fails at every job interview he has after quitting his last company. His life changes after he meets http://anidb.net/ch81232 [Yoake Ryou] of the ReLife Research Institute, who offers him a drug that can change his appearance to 17-year-old in order to make him a subject in an experiment for one year. Thus, he begins his life as a high school student once more. Source: MU Note: The series was first completely released on Comico app on 2016-06-24. Regular TV airing started 2016-07-02.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: track and field
tag.description: A collection of sports events that involve running, throwing, and jumping.

tag.name: volleyball
tag.description: Volleyball is a team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team`s court under organized rules. Use the http://anidb.net/t7147 [competitive beach volleyball] tag for competition or professional beach volleyball play. Use the http://anidb.net/t6478 [beach volleyball episode] tag when the beach volleyball game is a one-off event, such as during a beach or pool visit.

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: angst
tag.description: A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression. Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing. Etymology: "Angst" is a German word meaning fear or anxiety.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: open-ended
tag.description: The ending of this anime is left to the viewer`s imagination. There are no clear hints at a definite story outcome, several possibilities are presented without closure, or the story ends suddenly without explanation. There may also be room for a sequel.

tag.name: bullying
tag.description: Bullying is the use of force, threat, or coercion to abuse, intimidate, or aggressively dominate others. One who engages in bullying is known as a bully. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: sociocultural evolution
tag.description: Describes how cultures and societies develop over time, based on both cultural evolution and social evolution. A post-apocalyptic or a Utopian setting would show very interesting changes in human behaviour, mental state, or simply daily life.

tag.name: facial distortion
tag.description: The characters face are exaggerated into a misshape, deformed, and almost warped. Used as comedy element to express extreme mood swings. Differing from "http://anidb.net/t2652 [Super Deformed]", here only the face changes to an extreme degree, not the whole body of the protagonist.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: subtle OP ED sequence change
tag.description: A (small) part of the opening or ending sequence changes after a certain episode, usually to reflect a plot milestone.

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: sense of foreboding
tag.description: The anime starts off quietly, everything seems to be fine, but from episode to episode the signs that something ominous is about to happen increase. E.g. a typical mystery setting.

tag.name: social commentary
tag.description:
Social commentary is the act of rebelling against an individual, or a group of people by rhetorical means. This is most often done with the idea of implementing or promoting change by informing the general populace about a given problem and appealing to people’s sense of justice. (Source: Wikipedia)
Since this is anime, usually, the mores of Japan and the Japanese society are scrutinised, but not restricted to that.

tag.name: age change
tag.description: Because who wouldn`t like to be young/old again.

tag.name: put right what once went wrong
secret organisation
tag.description: A secret organisation or secret society is an organisation whose activities and inner functioning are concealed from non-members. The society may or may not attempt to conceal its existence itself. Examples of historical and existing secret societies include Freemasonry, the Knights Templar, the Rosicrucians, Skull and Bones, the Thule Society, and the Illuminati.

tag.name: jealousy
tag.description: A character is jealous of another character either due to love, or power, or wealth.

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: adapted into Japanese movie
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a Japanese movie. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Hishiro Chizuru
character.description: Hishiro Chizuru is a very smart but socially awkward classmate of http://anidb.net/ch79914 [Arata]. She usually scores the top grades in her year, which makes her the class representative and has all her school expenses paid for as a result. She is not only socially awkward, but also fairly ignorant with regards to anything not directly related to school matters, particularly social and emotional ones. She`s always doing research online on whatever she doesn`t understand. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kaizaki Arata
character.description: Kaizaki Arata is a 27-year old man who only appears to be 17-years old high school student, as a result of participating as test subject in ReLife Project. He was approached by http://anidb.net/ch81232 [Yoake Ryou] who explained him the rules he need to follow and goal to achieve as a test subject, as well as gave him the pill that made him younger in appearance. Ryou also became his supervisor. As a high school student, Arata is predictably seen as mature by his classmates and has no problem easily making friends. He has forgotten most of his high school lessons, so he needs to take many remedial tests. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Yoake Ryou
character.description: Yoake Ryou is http://anidb.net/ch79914 [Kaizaki]`s ReLife supervisor, the man who offered him the ReLife experiment. He is at the same age as Arata and always seems cheerful (which in fact irritates Kaizaki to no end). Being the supervisor, he always watches over Arata from a distance, and writes a report about his daily life. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ooga Kazuomi
character.description: Ooga Kazuomi is http://anidb.net/ch79914 [Arata]`s classmate who is the class representative along with http://anidb.net/ch79913 [Chizuru]. He performs well academically, but has very poor athletic ability. He lacks social prowess when it comes to romance, with the help of Arata and their friends he realizes his feelings for http://anidb.net/ch81235 [Rena], claiming that he wants to be with her, and doesn`t want her to be with another guy. His older brother was once a cheerful man who became a NEET due to heavy pressure and later is chosen to take part in the ReLife program as Project #005 by http://anidb.net/ch94724 [Arata Kaizaki]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Onoya An
character.description: Onoya An is another transfer student at Aoba High School. She`s actually http://anidb.net/ch81232 [Yoake Ryou]`s junior supervisor and the one who scouted http://anidb.net/ch79914 [Arata] for the experiment. Like Ryou, she acts cheerfully and together with watching their project to the point it becomes stalking, much to Arata`s annoyance. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kariu Rena
character.description: Kariu Rena is http://anidb.net/ch79914 [Arata]`s classmate who sits next to him and is a volleyball club member. A girl who is very competitive, she wants to be the best at everything. She thinks of http://anidb.net/ch79913 [Chizuru] and http://anidb.net/ch81889 [Honoka] as her rivals, but is on good terms with them. Rena is stubborn and proud, but actually genuinely confused inside. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Asaji Nobunaga
character.description: Asaji Nobunaga is http://anidb.net/ch81889 [Honoka] and http://anidb.net/ch81888 [Akira]`s childhood friend, he acts like the mother of the group and he is a member of the health committee. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Inukai Akira
character.description: Inukai Akira is http://anidb.net/ch81889 [Honoka] and http://anidb.net/ch81887 [Nobunaga]`s childhood friend. He has sharp and glaring eyes. He is very protective of Honoka and so he gets mad at anyone caught leering at her. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Tamarai Honoka
character.description: Tamarai Honoka is http://anidb.net/ch81235 [Rena]`s best friend and the captain of the female volleyball team at their school. A naive, friendly, and sweet girl. She has noticeably large breasts which are a bit of the running gag. Having a strong aptitude and athletic ability, she felt pressure from people who can`t surpass her, which is why Rena`s claim to be her rival makes Honoka treasure their friendship. Despite being a genius at sports, she isn`t very good academically. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Amatsu Kokoro
character.description: Amatsu Kokoro is homeroom teacher at http://anidb.net/ch79914 [Arata]`s class. She is also the PE teacher and female volleyball club`s supervisor. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Usa Koushi
character.description: Usa Koushi is male volleyball supervisor and a PE teacher. He was http://anidb.net/ch82285 [Kokoro]`s senior at university and they are sort of rivals. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Inukai Sumire
character.description: Inukai Sumire is public health doctor of Aoba Academy. She`s also http://anidb.net/ch81888 [Akira]`s older sister. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Saiki Michiru
character.description: Saiki Michiru was a staff member at the company that http://anidb.net/ch94724 [Arata] worked in. She later committed suicide after being harassed by fellow employees. Her suicide had a great impact on Arata, rendering him unable to function in society. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kaizaki Arata
character.description: Kaizaki Arata is a 27-year old man who became unemployed after quitting his job of 3 months at a black company, claiming the reason was "it did not fit his highest potential". After several failed job opportunities in similar companies, he worked part-time at a convenience store where he was scouted by http://anidb.net/ch81234 [Onoya An] who chose him for the ReLife Project. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Hishiro Chizuru
character.description: Hishiro Chizuru is actually Project #001, another ReLife subject like http://anidb.net/ch94724 [Arata]. Due to her personality, the experiment was deemed a failure as there was no improvement. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Yoake Ryou
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch81232 [Yoake Ryou], as an adult, after he took the pills that reversed the effects caused by the pills used in ReLife experiment.

episode.title: 墜ちる
Fall
Tomber de haut
Ochiru
episode.summary: Kariu Rena is thrown for a loop by what she thinks is Chizuru`s spiteful behavior toward her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オッサンなんですから
You`re Old Now
Plus tout jeune
Ossan Nandesukara
episode.summary: Arata receives a grim reminder of his physical age during athletic testing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コミュニケーション能力0点
Communication Skills: Zero
Zéro pointé en relationnel
İletişim Kabiliyeti: Sıfır
Communication Nouryoku 0-ten
episode.summary: Arata meets Hishiro Chiziru, a girl who has zero communication skills but is trying her best to change. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 海崎新太(27)無職
Kaizaki Arata (27), Unemployed
Arata Kaizaki, 27 ans, au chômage
Kaizaki Arata (Yaş 27), İşsiz
Kaizaki Arata (27) Mushoku
episode.summary: Kaizaki Arata is twenty-seven years old and doesn`t have a steady job. His parents even threaten to stop sending him money, but that`s when he he meets Yoake Ryo, who has a tantalizing offer for him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 告白
Confession
Déclaration d`amour
Kokuhaku
episode.summary: At the fireworks display, everyone puts their plans into motion and tries to make things work between Kazuomi and Rena. Meanwhile, a different pairing begins to take shape... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダブルパニック
Double Panic
Panique à bord
Double Panic
episode.summary: Arata, once and for all, tries to make the dense-as-can-be Kazuomi realize what he has in his hands. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 過去トリップ
A Trip to the Past
Plongée dans le passé
Kako Trip
episode.summary: Arata decides to visit a grave and ends up taking a trip down memory lane. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなのワガママ
Everyone`s Selfish Desires
À chacun son égoïsme
Minna no Wagamama
episode.summary: Things come to a head as Chizuru and Arata decide to confront Rena over her behavior. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リベンジ
Revenge
Revanche
Revenge
episode.summary: The rift between Rena and Honoka grows ever larger as the former decides to retire from high-school volleyball, but Chizuru and Arata decide to fix things. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 亀裂
Rift
Rupture
Kiretsu
episode.summary: Honoka is distracted by her troubles and inadvertently causes an injury to Rena. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 被験者001→002
Test Subject 001 -> 002
Sujet nº 1 ➝ nº 2
Hikensha 001->002
episode.summary: Ryo reflects on the year before and his failure supporting test subject no. 001 Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 初めましてじゃないんだよ
This Isn`t the First Time
On se connaît déjà
Hajimemashite ja Nainda yo
episode.summary: Onoya An and Oga Kazuomi suddenly visit Arata for a study session, after which Onoya puts the moves on Arata?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オーバーラップ
Overlap
Ressemblance
Overlap
episode.summary: Things come to a head between Rena and Chizuru, which reminds Arata about a traumatic experience in his past. Source: crunchyroll
